The Marble gargoyle is a superior variant of the gargoyle. It has a chance of spawning after purchasing the unlock Bigger and Badder for 150 Slayer reward points from any Slayer master.

Unlike most other superior monsters, marble gargoyles use two combat styles: melee and ranged. Both its standard attacks can hit very high, though they are somewhat inaccurate. It is recommended to pray melee. Killing these with a ranged weapon is much easier, as you can pray ranged and negate all damage, excluding the special attack. You will need to carry the range item switches in your inventory while killing normal gargoyles if using this method.

In combat, the marble gargoyle will occasionally launch a grey ball towards the player. If hit by the projectile (magic), it will inflict up to 38 damage and immobilise the player for a few seconds. The message box states "You have been trapped in stone!" when this occurs. Players are able to avoid this attack by moving at least one tile away from their original position once the projectile is launched.

A marble gargoyle fires its special attack.

Drops[edit | edit source]

In addition to 100% drops and tertiary drops, superior slayer monsters will always roll 3 additional items, of which only 1 roll may be from the superior unique table. The other rolls are performed on the regular counterpart's table; their displayed drop chances represent a single roll.

The following drop rates are provided by Jagex, unless otherwise specified.[1]

The average Marble gargoyle kill is worth 98,353.62.

The average Marble gargoyle kill while on a Konar task is worth 101,236.32.

Concept art[edit | edit source]

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • Unlike other superior foes, the Marble gargoyle has a higher combat level than its boss variant, the Grotesque Guardians, despite being much easier to kill. This is due to the boss' hitpoint reduction in a later update.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
1 November 2017
(update | poll)

The marble gargoyle was given another graphical update, and also had the appearance of its binding projectile changed from two squiggly purple lines (resembling a Monk of Zamorak's Magic attack) to a large grey ball.

23 February 2017
(update | poll)

The marble gargoyle was given a graphical update to be more distinguishable from their regular variant.
